Package fr.ensimag.deca.context

Class EnvironmentExp

java.lang.Object
fr.ensimag.deca.context.EnvironmentExp
public class EnvironmentExp extends Object
Dictionary associating identifier's ExpDefinition to their names. This is actually a linked list of dictionaries: each EnvironmentExp has a pointer to a parentEnvironment, corresponding to superblock (eg superclass). The dictionary at the head of this list thus corresponds to the "current" block (eg class). Searching a definition (through method get) is done in the "current" dictionary and in the parentEnvironment if it fails. Insertion (through method declare) is always done in the "current" dictionary.
Author:
gl19
Creation date:
01/01/2022

    • declare

      public void declare​(SymbolTable.Symbol name, ExpDefinition def) throws EnvironmentExp.DoubleDefException
      Add the definition def associated to the symbol name in the environment. Adding a symbol which is already defined in the environment, - throws DoubleDefException if the symbol is in the "current" dictionary - or, hides the previous declaration otherwise.
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the symbol to define
      def - Definition of the symbol
      Throws:
      EnvironmentExp.DoubleDefException - if the symbol is already defined at the "current" dictionary

      public void addMethods​(EnvironmentExp otherEnvironment, ClassDefinition cls, ClassDefinition SuperCls) throws ContextualError
      add methods in otherEnvironment to this environment with the corresponding Index
      Parameters:
      otherEnvironment - the environment containing the methods
      cls - the class definition
      SuperCls - the super class definition
      Throws:
      ContextualError
